page.title: 01GENERAL OVERVIEW 1
page.content: The area 3km North and 4km East of Grid Ref. 05600189 is predominately arable farmland. In the North is the heavily wooded Thorndon Country Park, and the Southern boundary is approximately marked by the Southend to London Arterial Road. The West is bordered by grass and common land and the Warley Park Golf Club, and to the East is more arable farmland. The Village of Ingrave and Herongate with its pleasant cricket green and two Public Houses lies astride the North West Corner. The land is gently and pleasantly undulating. There are a number of public paths leading to and from the Country Park, providing pleasurable and easy walks in a quiet rural environment despite the close proximity of Brentwood and a main trunk road to London.
